page.title: 14"Bee Keeping, Metheringham"
page.content: There are two bee keepers in Metheringham, Mr. Pillsworth and MR. Sellars. Mr. Pillsworth has twenty hives in his{apairy,}fifteen contain bees. Mr. Sellars has eight hives, six contain bees.A complete new bee hive, costs{Â£120.65.}From the end of May to July,swarms occur.Mr. Sellars had a swarm on the second of June so far Mr. Pillsworth has not had a swarm.The first honey is from the{blossom } followed by honey from{oil seed rape, {garden flowers,lime trees,clover}and occasionally{beans.}The honey is extracted from the comb as soon as it is sealed.Rape honey has to be extracted immediatly or it sets and can not be got without melting the comb. An inspector from the Ministry of Agriculture visits to check for diseases annually.
